results.title: Introduction to drawing materials
results.brief_description: Drawing materials and tools, such as pencils, pen and ink, tempera, watercolor, felt-tip pens and oil pastels have different qualities that can be discovered through experiment. Chalk goes on quickly and easily creating soft, muted effects; brilliantly colored crayons can make a line hard and sharp or soft and blurry. Shows drawings by Degas, Leonardo da Vinci, Cezanne, Van Gogh.

results.title: Introduction to design
results.creator_credit: F Treuthardt, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Made to foster an appreciation of the basic simple shapes in design. Poses the question “What is design?”. Answers that design is simply an orderly arrangement of lines and shapes. Aboriginal art in its simplicity of design is drawn from nature - if you look up, down and around you will too. Simple motifs are used in everyday articles.

results.title: Introduction to Denmark
results.creator_credit: Danish Government Film Office and Laterna Film
results.brief_description: The basic characteristics and major occupations of the people of a complex modern welfare state. The streets of Copenhagen; its people; the production of food; shipyards launching fishing boats; industries, factory mass production and handcraftsmanship; aspects of culture and recreation, all give revealing insights into this progressive and picturesque country.

results.title: Introduction to Crefal
results.brief_description: A picture of the land and people around Lake Patzcuaro, Mexico, site of the international fundamental education training and production centre for Latin America. At the Crefal Centre and in collaboration with UNESCO workers, training is given to village people to assist with maintaining traditional skills of fishing, farming and weaving.

results.title: Introduction to control
results.creator_credit: Brian Kaufman, Michael Clarke and AEI Film Unit
results.brief_description: Defines and illustrates the principles of industrial process control. Mechanical and automatic feedback control systems are compared and the film shows how automatic electronic control can be refined to handle a wide range of applications from huge and complex plant to the milling of a precision curve involving accuracies of 1/10,000th of an inch.

results.title: Introduction to Confucius
results.creator_credit: Sumner J. Glimcher, International Film Foundation and Mass Communications
results.brief_description: This film deals with the main tenets of Confucian thought which are clearly presented. Ancient Chinese music, art and many quotes from Confucius enrich the simple narrative.

results.title: Introduction to combat fatigue
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: This film was designed for screening to medical staff in a psychiatric hospital during World War II. It attempts to explain what fear is and how it can affect soldiers. Uses flash-backs to combat scenes to recall their fears.

results.title: Introduction to chemistry
results.brief_description: Begins by defining the science of chemistry and then shows how it is studied and demonstrates its industrial applications. Examples of the way in which our daily lives are affected by the work of chemists are then shown.

results.title: Introduction film for the American Enterprise series
results.creator_credit: James C. Crimmins, Mike Jackson and Playback Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Enterprise”.
Documentary on five 30 minute Films of American Enterprise from early pioneer days to the present day, emphasis on teamwork and organisational skills. Narrated by William Shatner.

results.title: Introduction
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Shows the three sections of a band - the brasses, the woodwinds, and the percussions - and explains the function of each group of instruments. Explains that the addition of a string section distinguishes an orchestra from a band. Includes demonstrations of well-known instruments from each section. Features the Jollet Township High School Band and the Youth Orchestra of Greater Chicago.
